Endpoints.Name: Get Indicative FX Quote
Endpoints.Description:
Requests an  indicative quote. There are two exclusive scenarios when requesting a rate between two currencies:

1. The caller provides a sell amount and is given the corresponding buy amount. In this case, the caller needs to populate the sellAmount and buyCurrency input parameters.

2. The caller provides a buy amount and is given the corresponding sell amount. In this case, the caller needs to populate the buyAmount and sellCurrency input parameters.

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: The request details to get an indicative FX quote. You must either supply the sellAmount and buyCurrency. Or you must supply the buyAmount and sellCurrency.

Errors.ErrorMessage: The requested operation could not be performed. Input Request is invalid or incorrect.
Unauthorized - Invalid API Key and Token.
An internal error has occurred in the Earthport payment platform.

Endpoints.Name: Get Balance
Endpoints.Description:
Retrieves the balance of a merchant account. 

This API can be used to retrieve a set of balances represented by a monetary amount for each currency registered with the merchant's central virtual account. 

You can filter the AccountBalance resource by currency if you require a balance for a specific currency. 
You can also filter the AccountBalance on managedMerchantName. If no managedMerchantName is specified, then the caller will be used to identify which balance to return. If a managedMerchantName is specified, then an authorisation check will occur to ensure that the caller has the right to view the balance information for that managed merchant.

Parameters.Name: managedMerchantName
Parameters.Description: The name of a managed merchant registered on Earthport.

Parameters.Name: currency
Parameters.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code.

Errors.ErrorMessage: The requested operation could not be performed. Input Request is invalid or incorrect.
Unauthorized - Invalid API Key and Token.
An internal error has occurred in the Earthport payment platform.

Endpoints.Name: Create FX Quote
Endpoints.Description:
Requests an FX quote and creates a ticket for the quote. This ticket is honoured for a specified duration which is limited by Rate Expiry Date/Time. There are two exclusive scenarios when requesting a rate between two currencies:

1. The caller provides a sell amount and is given the corresponding buy amount. In this case, the caller needs to populate the sellAmount and buyCurrency input parameters.

2. The caller provides a buy amount and is given the corresponding sell amount. In this case, the caller needs to populate the buyAmount and sellCurrency input parameters.

Parameters.Name: userID
Parameters.Description: The payer's unique id. It can be either VAN or merchant id.

Parameters.Name: bankID
Parameters.Description: Unique ID for the beneficiary bank account. It can be either earthport id or merchant id.

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: The request details to get an FX quote and receive a unique Ticket ID with a time to live.

Parameters.Name: idType
Parameters.Description: idType for the path parameters. This allows you to specify either your own UIDs or Earthport generated UIDs. The Earthport generated UIDs will be used by default.

Errors.ErrorMessage: The requested operation could not be performed. Input Request is invalid or incorrect.
Unauthorized - Invalid API Key and Token.
An internal error has occurred in the Earthport payment platform.

Endpoints.Name: Get Statement
Endpoints.Description:
Retrieves a list of financial transactions and balances for a specified time period for an account administered in the Earthport Payment system. To retrieve a particular statement the startDate, endDateTime and currency of the account must be specified. The statement returned will contain transactions that occurred since the start of the startDate up to and including endDateTime. If the account (in the requested currency) does not contain any transactions for the period an empty statement is returned. Every transaction, together with the money movement it represents (debit or credit) and its resulting account balance are represented as a statement line item. There will be a number of statement line items (up to the maximum page size) per page with an opening and closing balance for that page. Currently the following transaction types may show up on a statement:

 Payout transaction,
 Refund transaction,
 User deposit,
 Liquidity deposit,
 Journal transaction,
 Merchant liquidity movement,
 Earthport Merchant Liquidity Transfer

The operation supports sorting (by date) by specifying a sort order (ASC or DESC) and paging across multiple pages of results.

Parameters.Name: currency
Parameters.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. The currency code representing currency of the user or merchant account.

Parameters.Name: startDateTime
Parameters.Description: Valid ISO 8601 timestamp, i.e. yyyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. The start day of the statement period. All transactions from the start of the day are included.

Parameters.Name: endDateTime
Parameters.Description: Valid ISO 8601 timestamp, i.e. yyyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ. The end day timestamp of the statement period. If this is now or null the statement will include all transactions up to the current point in time.

Parameters.Name: sortOrder
Parameters.Description: Sort by transaction date in either Ascending or Descending order.

Parameters.Name: managedMerchantName
Parameters.Description: Managed merchant whose transactions will be returned  when being called by the contracting merchant.

Parameters.Name: offset
Parameters.Description: This is used for pagination of resultsets. 0-based starting offset of the page with respect to the entire resultset.

Parameters.Name: pageSize
Parameters.Description: This is used for pagination of resultsets. Number of items per page to return. If empty the maximum allowable (25) number of records will be returned.

Errors.ErrorMessage: The requested operation could not be performed. Input Request is invalid or incorrect.
Unauthorized - Invalid API Key and Token.
An internal error has occurred in the Earthport payment platform.

Endpoints.Name: Search Transactions
Endpoints.Description:
This allows you to search for payments where you don't know the UID (paymentID) and also allows you to search for other financial transaction types on your account such as refunds, deposits (See Transaction Type). 

This API supports sorting by "Timestamp" or "Amount" in a particular sort order (ASC or DESC) as well as paging across multiple pages of results.

Parameters.Name: startDateTime
Parameters.Description: Start Date Time in yyyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Parameters.Name: endDateTime
Parameters.Description: End Date Time in yyyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ.

Parameters.Name: sortOrder
Parameters.Description: Sort in either ascending or descending order.

Parameters.Name: sortFields
Parameters.Description: Sort Fields. It can be either Timestamp or Amount or a combination of both. If you want to sort the results based on both the sort fields please provide a comma seperated list of sort fields, i.e. Timestamp,Amount

Parameters.Name: managedMerchantName
Parameters.Description: Managed merchant whose transactions will be returned  when being called by the contracting merchant.

Parameters.Name: currency
Parameters.Description: Transaction currency (valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code).

Parameters.Name: amountFrom
Parameters.Description: Decimal amount value. The number of decimal places is defined by the currency.This is the lower limit of transaction value (inclusive).

Parameters.Name: amountTo
Parameters.Description: Decimal amount value. The number of decimal places is defined by the currency.This is the upper limit of transaction value (inclusive).

Parameters.Name: merchantTransactionID
Parameters.Description: Merchant assigned transaction ID (transaction reference).

Parameters.Name: transactionType
Parameters.Description: Type of financial transactions. Please provide one of the following transaction types (if none specified all types are searched): Payout, Refund, User Deposit, Merchant Liquidity Deposit, Journal, Merchant Liquidity Movement, Earthport Merchant Liquidity Transfer

Parameters.Name: transactionStatusCode
Parameters.Description: Status Code of the Transactions.

Parameters.Name: offset
Parameters.Description: This is used for pagination of resultsets. 0-based starting offset of the page with respect to the entire resultset.

Parameters.Name: pageSize
Parameters.Description: This is used for pagination of resultsets. Number of items per page to return. If empty the maximum allowable (25) number of records will be returned.

Errors.ErrorMessage: The requested operation could not be performed. Input Request is invalid or incorrect.
Unauthorized - Invalid API Key and Token.
An internal error has occurred in the Earthport payment platform.

TestCases.Description: This allows you to search for payments where you don't know the UID (paymentID) and also allows you to search for other financial transaction types on your account such as refunds, deposits (See Transaction Type).

CustomTypes.Name: Payments Create Request
CustomTypes.Description: This is a composite request. It is used when you have to create a payment request to a beneficiary bank account which is not previously registered on the earthport payment system. This request is also extended to create a payment request on behalf of a user that is not previously registered on the earthport system.

Fields.Name: user
Fields.Description: A user Object. This user objected will be verified agaist the previously registered users in the merchant account based on the UserID parameter. if one already exists then the payer identity information of the existing account will be updated with that specified in the request.

Fields.Name: bankAccount
Fields.Description: The beneficiary bank account Object. If the beneficiary bank account is a duplicate of one previously registered against the supplied UserID, the existing beneficiary bank account will be used for creating a payment.

Fields.Name: payment
Fields.Description: Beneficiary Bank account payment. This object is used to supply the payout information.

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description: Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: payer
Fields.Description: The Payer Type is optional. If no Payer Type is specified then the default value of authenticatedCaller will be used.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

Fields.Name: usersBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of a collection of both the user ID group and beneficiary bank ID group. The 'userID' is a collection of user identifier types. The 'benBankID' is a collection of account identifier types. Both the 'userID' and 'benBankID' fields are mandatory.

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryIdentityFieldGroupChoice
CustomTypes.Description: This type defines that in common case at least one of the nested groups should be included into addBeneficiaryBankAccount request document. On UI it can be presented with drop-down list containing nested groups labels. 'minElementNum' minimum this number of the nested groups should be specified (1 by default). 'maxElementNum' maximum this number of the nested groups can be specified (1 by default).

Fields.Name: maxGroupsListNum
Fields.Description: The maximum number of selections which need to be made from the choices.

Fields.Name: minGroupsListNum
Fields.Description: The minimum number of selections which need to be made from the choices.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryIdentityFieldGroupsList
Fields.Description: List of beneficiary identity field groups.

CustomTypes.Name: SortOrder
CustomTypes.Description: Specifies an order sequence.

Fields.Name: ASC
Fields.Description: Sort result set by chosen field in ASCENDING order.

Fields.Name: DESC
Fields.Description: Sort result set by chosen field in DESCENDING order.

CustomTypes.Name: Settlement Calendars Get Response
CustomTypes.Description: This represents a Settlement Calendar, with a range of settlement dates and the corresponding cut-off time.

Fields.Name: responseTimeStamp
Fields.Description: A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm. Represents the timestamp when the Settlement Calendar was generated.

Fields.Name: settlementCalendar
Fields.Description: Represents a calander of settlement dates and the cut-off time for these settlement dates.

CustomTypes.Name: Failure
CustomTypes.Description: An individual failure/error description. This is used by the ValidationException model.

Fields.Name: key
Fields.Description: Key identifies the specific field which is in error.

Fields.Name: code
Fields.Description: Earthport specific validation error code.

Fields.Name: value
Fields.Description: Descriptive explanation of the error.

CustomTypes.Name: AdditionalData
CustomTypes.Description: Represents a set of name value pairs that can be supplied with the Identity information. The keys will be validated on the server side against a list of valid types that are accepted. See the "API Solution Guide" for further details. Both the key and the value are required if adding additional data.

Fields.Name: Key
Fields.Description: This represents the 'key' of the additional data. The length of this field is currently restricted to 50 bytes, and will be truncated if the value is too long.

Fields.Name: Value
Fields.Description: This represents the 'value' of the additional data. The length of this field is currently restricted to 254 bytes, when used for Payer Identity, and 1024 bytes when used for Beneficiary Identity.The field value will be truncated if the value is too long.

CustomTypes.Name: BirthInformation
CustomTypes.Description: The group consists of elements that define birth information for an individual.

Fields.Name: cityOfBirth
Fields.Description: This represents the date of birth. The length of this field is limited to 254 bytes. This value will be truncated if it is too long.

Fields.Name: countryOfBirth
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. This represents the country of birth.

Fields.Name: dateOfBirth
Fields.Description: Valid ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD. This represents the date of birth.

CustomTypes.Name: LegalEntityRegistration
CustomTypes.Description: This group consists of a legal entity registration number type and the country that the legal entity is registered in. Legal Entity Registration Number is mandatory, Legal Entity Registration Country is mandatory and Legal Entity Registration Province is optional.

Fields.Name: legalEntityRegistrationCountry
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. This represents Registration Country of the Legal Entity.

Fields.Name: legalEntityRegistrationNumber
Fields.Description: The registration number component of the legal entity. The length of this field is limited to 254 bytes. 254 bytes can hold 254 normal English characters. This value will be truncated if it is too long.

Fields.Name: legalEntityRegistrationProvince
Fields.Description: Optional province of the legal entity's address.

CustomTypes.Name: BankAccountDetails
CustomTypes.Description: This group holds all possible account identifier types - listed below in alphabetical order. The data which should be supplied in this group differs depending on the bank account territory. Please refer to the integration guide for territory specific details of what should be supplied. The following set of parameter names are valid keys:- abaRoutingNumber, accountName, accountNumber, accountNumberPrefix, accountNumberSuffix, accountType, bankCode, bankName, branchCode, bic, holdingBranchName, iban, miscField1, miscField2, miscField3, sortCode, swiftBic.

Fields.Description: Type which defines the allowable data which may be passed to the "key" element of the BankAccountDetails.

Fields.Name: value
Fields.Description: Type which defines the allowable data which may be passed to the "value" element of the BankAccountDetails.

CustomTypes.Name: Beneficiary Bank Account Get Response
CustomTypes.Description: This type provides all the possible information required to identify a beneficiary bank account.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible user identifier types. The 'epUserID' field is a unique identifier for a merchant and is the equivalent of a Virtual Account Number (VAN). The 'merchantUserID' is a merchant specified identifier for an individual or company that an account was set up for. The 'epUserID', 'merchantUserID' or both 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant user ID from the supplied EP user ID and vice versa. If both the 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: benBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible beneficiary bank identifier types. The 'epBankID' field is a unique identifier for a beneficiary bank account. The 'merchantBankID' is an optional merchant specified identifier for the beneficiary bank account. The 'epBankID', 'merchantBankID' or both 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant bank ID from the supplied EP bank ID and vice versa. If both the 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents the beneficiary identity of an individual or legal entity.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Type which defines a beneficiary bank account description. Each bank account must be given a description therefore this is a mandatory component of the BeneficiaryBankAccount.

Fields.Name: countryCode
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. It is the territory in which this bank account is domiciled.

Fields.Name: currencyCode
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. The currency held in this bank account may optionally be supplied in this field.

Fields.Name: isActive
Fields.Description: Return true if the bank account is active

Fields.Name: bankAccountDetails
Fields.Description: This is a group of sub-elements which collectively identify both the bank and the account within the bank

CustomTypes.Name: Payments RegisteredBeneficiary Create Request
CustomTypes.Description: This request is used to request a payout to a given beneficiary bank account. This message is used by Earthport merchants who are requesting payouts on behalf of a customer.

Fields.Name: transactionID
Fields.Description: This group consists of merchant transaction reference only.

Fields.Name: payoutRequestAmount
Fields.Description: The requested payout amount and currency. The currency of the payout request amount is often different from the currency of the Beneficiary Bank Account. This represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryAmountInformation
Fields.Description: Used to specify the beneficiary amount and the payout currency.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

Fields.Name: beneficiaryStatementNarrative
Fields.Description: Narrative text to be displayed on the beneficiary bank accounts statement, where the banking network supports this.

Fields.Name: fxTicketID
Fields.Description: Optional FxTicket Id to be used. This is a unique reference sent back to the Merchant as a response to getFXQuote as UID. If specified, the system will honour the rate specified in the FX Ticket for the Payment. The Earthport System will validate the specified FX Ticket including TTL on the Ticket. If the TTL has expired, the Earthport system will throw an error.

Fields.Name: requestedFX
Fields.Description: Optional FX method to use in order to settle the payout request where the payout request currency and the beneficiary currency do not match.

Fields.Name: payoutType
Fields.Description: Reserved for future use. Will be used to state the Payout type.

Fields.Name: payoutDetails
Fields.Description: Additional information related to the payment such as Purpose of Payment.

Fields.Name: transactionHold
Fields.Description: Parameter to prevent transactions from being processed until the desired time has been reached. Note releaseDateTime must be in UTC format. Transaction hold is optional, If not provided the transaction will be processeed as soon as possible.

Fields.Name: fxTicketID

If specified, the system will honour the rate specified in the FX Ticket for the Payment. The Earthport System will validate the specified FX Ticket including TTL on the Ticket. If the TTL has expired, the Earthport system will throw an error.

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryIdentityField
CustomTypes.Description: Each BeneficiaryIdentityField would normally be displayed in the UI from left to right based on the tabOrder attribute. The BeneficiaryIdentityField element contains the attributes described below:-

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Suggested roll-over or help text description to assist users.

Fields.Name: displaySize
Fields.Description: A suggested field size to display.

Fields.Name: elementName
Fields.Description: The name of the element in the addBeneficiaryBankAccount request document for the corresponding field.

Fields.Name: inputType
Fields.Description: Supported input types for a beneficiary identity UI.

Fields.Name: locale
Fields.Description: The localisation setting of this particular record.

Fields.Name: mandatory
Fields.Description: Indicates whether the field is mandatory.

Fields.Name: maxSize
Fields.Description: Suggested client side syntactic validation rule.

Fields.Name: parameterName
Fields.Description: The name of the corresponding Earthport parameter to use when calling addBeneficiaryBankAcount.

Fields.Name: separator
Fields.Description: The separator to display following (to the right hand side) this field, usually '-' or '/'.

Fields.Name: subTitle
Fields.Description: If present contains a sub-label to be displayed with the field.

Fields.Name: tabOrder
Fields.Description: Indicates the ordering of this field in the UI.

Fields.Name: valueRegexp
Fields.Description: The regexp for the value of this field.

Fields.Name: listItems
Fields.Description: The beneficiaryIdentityField contains optional listItem sub-elements. The listItem sub-elements would normally be present where the inputType attribute is 'list'.

CustomTypes.ExampleValue:
{
  "description": "Enter the first name of the beneficiary",
  "displaySize": 35,
  "elementName": "givenNames",
  "inputType": "text",
  "locale": "en",
  "mandatory": true,
  "maxSize": 1024,
  "subTitle": "The first name of the beneficiary",
  "tabOrder": 1
}

CustomTypes.Name: PayerType
CustomTypes.Description: The type of Payer making the payment. This determines which identity details are used as the payer identity.

Fields.Name: authenticatedCaller
Fields.Description: Payout is being requested on behalf of the requesting merchant.

Fields.Name: managedMerchant
Fields.Description: Payout is being requested on behalf of a managed merchant.

Fields.Name: user
Fields.Description: Payout is being requested on behalf of a user.

CustomTypes.Name: PayoutDetails
CustomTypes.Description: Allows additional data to be supplied with a payout Refer to documentation for valid keys.

Fields.Name: key
Fields.Description: Type which defines the allowable data which may be passed to the "key" element of the PayoutDetails.

Fields.Name: value
Fields.Description: Type which defines the allowable data which may be passed to the "value" element of the PayoutDetails.

CustomTypes.Name: Quotes Bulk Response
CustomTypes.Description: This response is used to represent cross rates between the required sell currencies and buy currencies. A ticket is created on EarthPort payment system for such quotes.

Fields.Name: fxTicketID
Fields.Description: FxTicketID is the unique number within the Earthport System representing the list of the FX Quotes presented to the Merchant. This is represented as an FX Ticket ID in Payment Request. Payout Request's specified with the optional FX Ticket Id will be validated against TTL (ExpiryTimestamp). The Earthport system will throw a validation error if TTL is expired.

Fields.Name: expiryTimestamp
Fields.Description: A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm. ExpiryTimestamp represents the datetime value till what the specified FxTicketID is valid. This means that all	rates in the ticket will be valid till this datetime.

Fields.Name: bulkFXDetail
Fields.Description: Represents the list of fxRates and their details.

CustomTypes.Name: Statement
CustomTypes.Description: The statement of transactions for a merchant account. This lists all debits and credits against this account. The results are paginated so may only be showing a subset of the total number of transactions. The statement also returns the opening and closing balances so can be used for reconciliation.

Fields.Name: statementLineItems
Fields.Description: List of 0 or more statement line item objects matching the request parameters. Each statement line item represents a financial transaction and an account balance resulting from the transaction.

Fields.Name: openingBalance
Fields.Description: This element represents the opening balance of a merchant account or a managed merchant account.

Fields.Name: closingBalance
Fields.Description: This element represents the closing balance of a merchant account or a managed merchant account.

Fields.Name: paginationResult
Fields.Description: This returns a paged set of results rather than the full result set.

CustomTypes.Name: MonetaryValue
CustomTypes.Description: Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: amount
Fields.Description: Decimal amount value. The number of decimal places is defined by the currency.

Fields.Name: currency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code.

CustomTypes.Name: RequestedFX
CustomTypes.Description: Method of FX that is requested by the merchant and for which EPS2 will attempt to use in order to settle the payout request.

Fields.Name: FF
Fields.Description: (Fixed to Fixed) is where no FX will be performed as payout and beneficiary currencies are the same.

Fields.Name: FV
Fields.Description: FV (Fixed to Variable) uses the supplied payout request amount in order to determine the beneficiary amount.

Fields.Name: VF
Fields.Description: VF (Variable to Fixed) uses the supplied beneficiary amount in order to determine the payout amount.

CustomTypes.Name: ServiceLevel
CustomTypes.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

Fields.Name: standard
Fields.Description: Standard service level payments.

Fields.Name: express
Fields.Description: Express service level payments.

CustomTypes.Name: Quotes Bulk Request
CustomTypes.Description: This request is used to retrieve cross rates between the required sell currencies and buy currencies.

Fields.Name: sellCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Sell Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to be debited in.

Fields.Name: buyCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Buy Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to buy or convert the sell currency into. For a Payment Request this must be one of the currencies registered for a Beneficiary Bank Account, otherwise the Earthport system will throw a validation error.

Fields.Name: buyCountry
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. Represents Buy Country for which FxRate was found.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

CustomTypes.Name: User
CustomTypes.Description: A user Object.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of merchant user identifier only.

Fields.Name: managedMerchantIdentity
Fields.Description: Refers to the descriptive name used to identify a given merchant. It is unique across Earthport merchants.

Fields.Name: accountCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. This is used to set a default account currency.

Fields.Name: payerIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents the payer identity of an individual or legal entity. You must specify one of either an individual identity or legal entity identity or unstructured identity.

CustomTypes.Name: Transactions Cancel Response
CustomTypes.Description: This represents the response of a cancellation request for a transaction (payout instruction).

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: Specifies the status of the associated transaction for the cancellation request.

Fields.Example: Cancellation Request received for a transaction that cannot be cancelled immediately.
Fields.Name: statusDescription
Fields.Description: Description associated with the cancellation status.

Fields.Name: timestamp
Fields.Description: A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm. This represents the cancellation request timestamp.

CustomTypes.Name: IdType
CustomTypes.Description: Type of resource ID (UID) to be used for the API call.

Fields.Name: merchant
Fields.Description: Use your own UIDs.

Fields.Name: earthport
Fields.Description: Use Earthport generated UIDs.

CustomTypes.Name: Identity
CustomTypes.Description: Represents the identity of an individual or legal entity. You must specify one of either an individual identity or legal entity identity or unstructured identity.

Fields.Name: individualIdentity
Fields.Description: The identity of an individual. The 'name' attribute is mandatory for an individual. You must supply at least identification entry or one birth information entry or one address entry.

Fields.Name: legalEntityIdentity
Fields.Description: The identity of a legal entity. The 'legalEntityName' is mandatory. You must supply one of 'legalEntityRegistration' or 'address'.

Fields.Name: unstructuredIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents a set of name value pairs that can be supplied as the Identity information. The keys will be validated on the server side against a list of valid types that are accepted.

Fields.Name: additionalData
Fields.Description: Represents a set of name value pairs that can be supplied with the Identity information.

CustomTypes.Name: Users Create or Validate Request
CustomTypes.Description: Body of the request to create or validate a User.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of merchant user identifier only.

Fields.Name: managedMerchantName
Fields.Description: Refers to the descriptive name used to identify a given merchant. It is unique across Earthport merchants.

Fields.Name: accountCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. This is used to set a default account currency.

Fields.Name: payerIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents the identity of an individual or legal entity. You must specify one of either an individual identity or legal entity identity or unstructured identity.

CustomTypes.Name: Bank Account Expected Settlement Response
CustomTypes.Description: This is the response to the Validate Beneficiary Bank Account API. The response will contain the element 'isBankAccountValid' which is a boolean representing if the specified beneficiary bank account is	valid. It will also return the expected settlement date of a payout based on supplied payout attributes in the request and the least cost route that can be used to settle against the beneficiary bank.

Fields.Name: isBankAccountValid
Fields.Description: Returns true if bank details have passed validation checks. In this case, the other response attributes of anticipatedPayoutRequestTime, serviceLevel and expectedSettlementDate are returned.

Fields.Name: anticipatedPayoutRequestTime
Fields.Description: A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm. This is the timestamp when the payout is anticipated to be sent to Earthport. This matches the supplied anticipatedPayoutRequestTime request attribute but the value returned will be in UTC (zero offset) dateTime. Therefore, a value supplied as 2013-01-20T12:30:00-05:00 will be returned as the UTC equivalent of 2013-01-20T17:30:00+00:00.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Service level can be standard or express: will match the value supplied in the service request, or default to 'standard' where no service level has been supplied.

Fields.Name: expectedSettlementDate
Fields.Description: Valid ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD. This is an indicative date when the payout instruction is expected to be settled to the bank.

CustomTypes.Name: Quotes Response
CustomTypes.Description: This represents a response of an FX Quote request. This contains a fxTicketID, which is a UID generated by EarthPort. The fxTicketID has an exchange rate which is honoured for a  specified duration. This UID should be presented in Payout Request if required.

Fields.Name: fxTicketID
Fields.Description: fxTicketID is the unique number within the Earthport System representing the FX Quote presented to the Merchant. This is represented as an FX Ticket ID in Payment Request. Payout Request's specified with the optional FX Ticket Id will be validated against TTL. The Earthport system will throw a validation error if TTL is expired.

Fields.Name: fxDetail
Fields.Description: FxDetail contains the sell amount, the buy amount and the fx rate on the ticket.

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryBankAccountField
CustomTypes.Description: Each beneficiaryBankAccountField would normally be displayed in the UI from left to right based on the tabOrder attribute. The beneficiaryBankAccountField element contains the attributes described below:-

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Suggested roll-over or help text description to assist users.

Fields.Name: displaySize
Fields.Description: A suggested field size to display.

Fields.Name: inputType
Fields.Description: Supported input types for a bank registration UI.

Fields.Name: locale
Fields.Description: The localisation setting of this particular record.

Fields.Name: maxSize
Fields.Description: Suggested client side syntactic validation rule.

Fields.Name: parameterName
Fields.Description: The name of the corresponding Earthport parameter to use when calling addBeneficiaryBankAcount.

Fields.Name: separator
Fields.Description: The separator to display following (to the right hand side) this field, usually '-' or '/'.

Fields.Name: subTitle
Fields.Description: If present contains a sub-label to be displayed with the field.

Fields.Name: tabOrder
Fields.Description: Indicates the ordering of this field in the UI.

Fields.Name: value
Fields.Description: The current value of this field, populated by the getBeneficiaryBankAccount service.

Fields.Name: listItems
Fields.Description: The beneficiaryBankAccountField contains optional listItem sub-elements. The listItem sub-elements would normally be present where the inputType attribute is 'list'.

CustomTypes.Name: LiquidityDepositTransaction
CustomTypes.Description: Financial transaction representing a deposit of liquidity (money) into a merchant account.

Fields.Name: amountCreditedToMerchantAccount
Fields.Description: Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds. This amount represents the amount of money recieved into the merchants account. This is expected to be the same as the financial transaction amount.

Fields.Name: amountReceivedAtBank
Fields.Description: Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds. This amount represents the amount of money recieved on the statement line item. This may differ from amountCreditedToMerchantAccount due to charges or FX.

Fields.Name: depositCountry
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. This represents the Country of liquidity deposit.

Fields.Name: depositDate
Fields.Description: Valid ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD. This represents the date of liquidity deposit.

Fields.Name: depositReference
Fields.Description: A Merchant User Deposit Reference.

Fields.Name: fxExecutedDetail
Fields.Description: Holds details of an executed FX conversion that has occured as part of a financial transaction. The FX that occured was from the sellCurrency to the buyCurrency at a particular rate. The rate may have been requested via an FX Quote (fxTicketID). An FX conversion fee may have been applied to certain transaction types.

Fields.Name: unappliedReason
Fields.Description: The reason the deposit was not applied to the merchant's virtual account.

CustomTypes.Name: TransactionHold
CustomTypes.Description: Parameter to prevent transactions from being processed until the desired time has been reached. Note releaseDateTime must be in UTC format.

Fields.Name: offsetMinutes
Fields.Description: This is the time in minutes to hold the transaction until.

Fields.Name: releaseDateTime
Fields.Description: This is used when you want to provide a specific timestamp to hold the transaction until. A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm.

CustomTypes.Name: Transactions Search Response
CustomTypes.Description: This represents the response of Transactions Search. It contains a number of transactions which match the search criteria and details of pagination on resultset.

Fields.Name: transactions
Fields.Description: Represents a transaction. This can any type of transaction among Payout transaction, Refund transaction, User deposit, Liquidity deposit, Journal transaction, Merchant liquidity movement and Earthport Merchant Liquidity Transfer.

Fields.Name: paginationResult
Fields.Description: This returns a paged set of results rather than the full result set.

CustomTypes.Name: Quotes Request
CustomTypes.Description: This request is used to retrieve a cross rate between the required sell currency and buy currency.

Fields.Name: sellAmount
Fields.Description: Sell Amount is the liquidity amount the merchant is debited in order to buy the Buy Currency. For  a Payment Request this will often (but not necessarily) be the amount that the merchant wishes to be debited in. This represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: buyCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Buy Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to buy or convert the sell currency into. For a Payment Request this must be one of the currencies registered for a Beneficiary Bank Account or Beneficiary Wallet, otherwise the Earthport system will throw a validation error.

Fields.Name: buyAmount
Fields.Description: Buy Amount is the monetary amount the merchant wishes to pay to the beneficiary. For a Payment Request this must be one of the currencies registered for a Beneficiary Bank Account or Beneficiary Wallet, otherwise the Earthport system will throw a validation error. This represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: sellCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Sell Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to be debited in, in order to buy the Buy Amount.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

CustomTypes.Name: TransactionType
CustomTypes.Description: Type of financial transaction

Fields.Name: Payout
Fields.Description: A financial transaction representing a payout from an account held in the EPS system.

Fields.Name: Refund
Fields.Description: A financial transaction representing a refund (by a bank or other third-party) to the merchant's account.

Fields.Name: User Deposit
Fields.Description: A financial transaction representing money paid into a merchant's account by a user.

Fields.Name: Merchant Liquidity Deposit
Fields.Description: Financial transaction representing a deposit of liquidity (money) into a merchant account.

Fields.Name: Earthport to Merchant Liquidity Transfer
Fields.Description: Financial transaction representing the transfer of liquidity from an Earthport account to a Merchants Central account.

CustomTypes.Name: BenBankID
CustomTypes.Description: This group consists of all possible beneficiary bank identifier types. The 'epBankID' field is a unique identifier for a beneficiary bank account. The 'merchantBankID' is an optional merchant specified identifier for the beneficiary bank account. The 'epBankID', 'merchantBankID' or both 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant bank ID from the supplied EP bank ID and vice versa. If both the 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: epBankID

Fields.Name: merchantBankID

CustomTypes.Name: Quotes Indicative Request
CustomTypes.Description: This request is used to retrieve an indicative FX rate between the required sell currency and buy currency.

Fields.Name: sellAmount
Fields.Description: Sell Amount is the liquidity amount the merchant is debited in order to buy the Buy Currency. For a Payment Request this will often (but not necessarily) be the amount that the merchant wishes to be debited in. This represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: buyCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Buy Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to buy or convert the sell currency into. For a Payment Request this must be one of the currencies registered for a Beneficiary Bank Account, otherwise the Earthport system will throw a validation error.

Fields.Name: buyAmount
Fields.Description: Buy Amount is the monetary amount the merchant wishes to pay to the beneficiary. For a Payment Request this must be one of the currencies registered for a Beneficiary Bank Account, otherwise the Earthport system will throw a validation error. This represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: sellCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Sell Currency is the currency the merchant wishes to be debited in, in order to buy the Buy Amount.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Supported service levels for a payout request (standard or express).

Fields.Name: buyCurrency
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. Represents Buy Currency for which FxRate was found.

Fields.Name: buyCountry
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code. Buy Country is the country of the Beneficiary Bank where the merchant wishes to buy or convert the sell currency.

Fields.Name: serviceLevel
Fields.Description: Represents Service Level for which FxRate was found.

Fields.Name: buyFxRate
Fields.Description: Represents the FX rate between two currencies that will be applied during a buy direction trade â€“ buying x amount of beneficiary currency (buyCurrency). The rate is restricted to 6 decimal places.

Fields.Name: sellFxRate
Fields.Description: Represents the FX rate between two currencies that will be effective during a sell direction trade â€“ selling x amount of payout instruction currency (sellCurrency). The rate is restricted to 6 decimal places.

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryBankAccountSummary
CustomTypes.Description: Represents a summary of a bank account. This type masks sensitive account information such as Account Numbers and IBANs.

Fields.Name: benBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible beneficiary bank identifier types. The 'epBankID' field is a unique identifier for a beneficiary bank account. The 'merchantBankID' is an optional merchant specified identifier for the beneficiary bank account. The 'epBankID', 'merchantBankID' or both 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant bank ID from the supplied EP bank ID and vice versa. If both the 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Type which defines a beneficiary bank account description. Each bank account must be given a description therefore this is a mandatory component of the BeneficiaryBankAccount complex type.

Fields.Name: countryCode
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code.

Fields.Name: bankAccountDetails
Fields.Description: The bank account details such as accountName, bankName, accountNumber etc...The list of bank account fields vary by country.

Fields.Name: status
Fields.Description: Status of the bank account.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents the identity of an individual or legal entity. You must specify one of either an individual identity or legal entity identity or unstructured identity.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Type which defines a beneficiary bank account description. Each bank account must be given a description therefore this is a mandatory component.

Fields.Name: countryCode
Fields.Description: The territory in which this bank account is domiciled is mandatory and must be supplied in the 'countryCode' field as a valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code.

Fields.Name: currencyCode
Fields.Description: The currency held in this bank account may optionally be supplied in the 'currencyCode' field as a valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. If not supplied it will assume the default currency of the 'countryCode' parameter.

Fields.Name: bankAccountDetails
Fields.Description: This is a group of sub-elements which collectively identify both the bank and the account within the bank.

The 'merchantUserID' is a merchant specified identifier for an individual or company that an account was set up for. The 'epUserID', 'merchantUserID' or both 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant user ID from the supplied EP user ID and vice versa. If both the 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Description: This is the amount deposited by the user. Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: amountDepositedToMerchant
Fields.Description: This is the amount deposited to the merchant. Represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: fxExecutedDetail
Fields.Description: Holds details of an executed FX conversion that has occured as part of a financial transaction. The FX that occured was from the sellCurrency to the buyCurrency at a particular rate. The rate may have been requested via an FX Quote (fxTicketID). An FX conversion fee may have been applied to certain transaction types.

Fields.Name: unappliedReason
Fields.Description: The reason the deposit was not applied to the merchant's virtual account.

Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code.

Fields.Name: currencyCode
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code.

Fields.Name: locale

CustomTypes.Name: Payments Create Response
CustomTypes.Description: Response object to the payout request APIs.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible user identifier types. The 'epUserID' field is a unique identifier for a merchant and is the equivalent of a Virtual Account Number (VAN). The 'merchantUserID' is a merchant specified identifier for an individual or company that an account was set up for. The 'epUserID', 'merchantUserID' or both 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant user ID from the supplied EP user ID and vice versa. If both the 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: benBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible beneficiary bank identifier types. The 'epBankID' field is a unique identifier for a beneficiary bank account. The 'merchantBankID' is an optional merchant specified identifier for the beneficiary bank account. The 'epBankID', 'merchantBankID' or both 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant bank ID from the supplied EP bank ID and vice versa. If both the 'epBankID' and 'merchantBankID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: transactionID
Fields.Description: Transaction ID type which contains both the unique Earthport transaction ID and the merchant supplied transaction ID.

Fields.Name: correspondentChargesExpected
Fields.Description: A flag to indicate if correspondent charges are expected during the processing of the payout request.

Fields.Name: liquidityValue
Fields.Description: The liquidity value debited to service the payout request. It represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: settlementValue
Fields.Description: The settlement value that will be sent by instruction to the settlement bank. This value may be subject to charges applied by correspondent banks before being received by the beneficiary bank account. This will typically match the currency of the beneficiary bank account, unless this instruction will be settled using FX on receipt.It represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: feeValue
Fields.Description: The fee that was applied during the processing of the payout request. It represents a monetary value containing a decimal amount value along with a currency code. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: fxMethodExpected
Fields.Description: Method of FX that will be used to settle the payout request.

Fields.Name: fxRate
Fields.Description: Represents a foreign exchange rate used during a specific transaction. It represents an FX rate between two currencies, the rate is restricted to 6 decimal places. The currency code is a three letter ISO 4217 code. E.g. GBP for British sterling pounds.

Fields.Name: acceptedDate
Fields.Description: A valid ISO 8601 timestamp, such as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssÂ±hh:mm. This is the timestamp when the payout instruction was accepted by the system.

Fields.Name: expectedSettlementDate
Fields.Description: Valid ISO 8601 date format YYYY-MM-DD. This is an Indicative date when the payout instruction is expected to be settled to the bank. This is calculated taking into account such things as acceptedDate, the settlement agreement cut-off time and period, etc. It currently does not take into account individual countries' banking calendars.

Fields.Description: Description of purpose of payment code.

Fields.Name: purposeOfPaymentUsageRestrictions
Fields.Description: Usage restrictions apply where a specified code is only acceptable for a given type of payer or beneficiary. This attribute indicates whether the code can be used for Individuals and/or Legal Entities, for both payer and beneficiary parties. Additional field specifications identify further data that is required, given the chosen Purpose of Payment.

CustomTypes.Name: AdditionalFieldWithValues
CustomTypes.Description: Indicates the additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request along with an indication of whether this additional payout details entry is mandatory. This will also be followed by a series of 'fieldValues' that list the valid codes and descriptions that can be submitted as the value of the payoutDetail entry in the payout request.

Fields.Name: key
Fields.Description: Key for the 'additionalFieldWithValues' data field.

Fields.Name: label
Fields.Description: Label for the 'additionalFieldWithValues' data field.

Fields.Name: mandatory
Fields.Description: Is the 'additionalFieldWithValues' data field?

Fields.Name: fieldValue
Fields.Description: Value for the 'additionalFieldWithValues' data field.

CustomTypes.Name: PayoutTransaction
CustomTypes.Description: A financial transaction representing a payout from an account held in the EPS system.

Fields.Name: usersBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of a collection of both the user ID group and beneficiary bank ID group. The 'userID' is a collection of user identifier types. The 'benBankID' is a collection of account identifier types. Both the 'userID' and 'benBankID' fields are mandatory.

Fields.Name: payoutRequestAmount
Fields.Description: Monetary amount and currency of the original payout request.

Fields.Name: settlementInstructionAmount
Fields.Description: Monetary amount and currency of the settled payment.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryStatementNarrative
Fields.Description: Narrative text to be displayed on the beneficiary bank accounts statement, where the banking network supports this.

Fields.Name: payoutDetails
Fields.Description: Allows additional data to be supplied with a payout. Refer to documentation for valid keys.

Fields.Name: expectedSettlementDate
Fields.Description: Indicative date when the payout instruction is expected to be settled to the bank. This is calculated taking into account such things as acceptedDate, the settlement agreement cut-off time and period, etc. It currently does not take into account individual countries' banking calendars.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryBankCountry
Fields.Description: Country of the target beneficiary bank.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryBankCurrency
Fields.Description: Currency of the target beneficiary bank account.

Fields.Name: debitValueDate
Fields.Description: Timestamp when the payout instruction was accepted by the Earthport payment system.

Fields.Name: payerIdentity
Fields.Description: Identity information of the payer.

Fields.Name: payerCreatedDate
Fields.Description: Date payer was created.

CustomTypes.Name: AdditionalFieldWithValidator
CustomTypes.Description: Indicates an additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request, along with an indication of whether this additional payout details is mandatory. Also includes the validation expression that will be applied to the value. This is a regular expression, and may be blank if no validation will be applied.

Fields.Name: key
Fields.Description: Key for list option.

Fields.Name: label
Fields.Description: Label for list option.

Fields.Name: mandatory
Fields.Description: Indicates whether this additional payout details is mandatory.

Fields.Name: validation
Fields.Description: The validation expression that will be applied to the value. This is a regular expression, and may be blank if no validation will be applied.

CustomTypes.Name: AdditionalFieldsList
CustomTypes.Description: This optionally contains a list of additional data that may be required if the associated purpose of payment is selected. This section will list a selection of 'additionalFieldWithValues' and/or 'additionalFieldWithValidator':   'additionalFieldWithValues' indicates the additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request along with an indication of whether this additional payout details entry is mandatory. 'additionalFieldWithValues' will also be followed by a series of 'fieldValues' that list the valid codes and descriptions that can be submitted as the value of the payoutDetail entry in the payout request. 'additionalFieldWithValidator' indicates an additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request, along with an indication of whether this additional payout details is mandatory 'additionalFieldWithValidator' also includes the validation expression that will be applied to the value. This is a regular expression, and may be blank if no validation will be applied.

Fields.Name: additionalFieldWithValidator
Fields.Description: Indicates an additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request, along with an indication of whether this additional payout details is mandatory.

Fields.Name: additionalFieldWithValues
Fields.Description: Indicates the additional key that can be provided in the payoutDetails section of a payout request along with an indication of whether this additional payout details entry is mandatory.

CustomTypes.Name: Beneficiary Bank Account List Response
CustomTypes.Description: This type gives a summary of all the Beneficiary Bank Accounts. This is used by customers to list all of the active beneficiary bank accounts within the system for the specified UserID (epUserID or merchantUserID). Note that summary bank account details mask sensitive account information such as account numbers and IBANs.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryBankAccountSummary
Fields.Description: Bank account summary returned in the list beneficiary bank accounts service. The summary version of a bank account does not include the beneficiary identity details. It also masks or obfuscates sensitive data such as account numbers.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible user identifier types. The 'epUserID' field is a unique identifier for a merchant and is the equivalent of a Virtual Account Number (VAN). The 'merchantUserID' is a merchant specified identifier for an individual or company that an account was set up for. The 'epUserID', 'merchantUserID' or both 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' can be supplied. A mapping will be performed to retrieve the merchant user ID from the supplied EP user ID and vice versa. If both the 'epUserID' and 'merchantUserID' are supplied, a check will be performed to ensure that the two are mapped. If the two provided fields are not mapped, then a validation error code will be returned. At least one of the fields must be populated.

Fields.Name: paginationResult
Fields.Description: This returns a paged set of results rather than the full result set.

CustomTypes.Name: BankAccount
CustomTypes.Description: The beneficiary bank account Object. This type provides all the possible information required to identify a beneficiary bank account.

Fields.Name: benBankID
Fields.Description: This group consists of merchant beneficiary bank identifier only.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryIdentity
Fields.Description: Represents the identity of an individual or legal entity. You must specify one of either an individual identity or legal entity identity or unstructured identity.

Fields.Name: description
Fields.Description: Type which defines a beneficiary bank account description. Each bank account must be given a description therefore this is a mandatory component.

Fields.Name: countryCode
Fields.Description: The territory in which this bank account is domiciled. This is a valid supported ISO 3166 2-character country code.

Fields.Name: currencyCode
Fields.Description: Valid supported ISO 4217 3-character currency code. The currency held in this bank account may optionally be supplied. If not supplied it will assume the default currency of the 'countryCode' parameter.

Fields.Name: bankAccountDetails
Fields.Description: This group holds the key-value pair of all possible account identifiers.

CustomTypes.Name: ValidationException
CustomTypes.Description: Earthport custom validation exception to handle validation errors. This will be the structure of the payload for various HTTP 4xx errors.

Fields.Name: timeOfFailure
Fields.Description: Timestamp of the failure.

Fields.Name: failureType
Fields.Description: Type of failure - will always be validation.

Fields.Example: Beneficiary Bank Account failed validation process
Fields.Name: shortMsg
Fields.Description: Short descriptive message of the error.

Fields.Name: longMsg
Fields.Description: More descriptive message of the error.

Fields.Name: code
Fields.Description: An Earthport specific error code.

Fields.Name: uniqueErrorID
Fields.Description: An Earthport generated unique error ID.

Fields.Name: failures
Fields.Description: An array of validation failures. For instance, if this error is during the creation or validation of a bank account, then each failure could relate to each individual bank account field validation error.

CustomTypes.Name: PurposeOfPaymentUsageRestrictions
CustomTypes.Description: Usage restrictions apply where a specified code is only acceptable for a given type of payer or beneficiary. This attribute indicates whether the code can be used for Individuals and/or Legal Entities, for both payer and beneficiary parties. Additional field specifications identify further data that is required, given the chosen Purpose of Payment.

Fields.Name: additionalFieldsList
Fields.Description: Additional fields will be one of two types; free text or list options. 'additionalFieldWithValues' gives a list of acceptable responses. 'additionalFieldWithValidator' is a free text response.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryType
Fields.Description: Indicates whether this purpose of payment code is valid if the beneficiary is an individual or legal entity.

Fields.Name: originatorType
Fields.Description: Indicates whether this purpose of payment code is valid if the originator is an individual or legal entity.

CustomTypes.Name: Payments RegisteredBeneficiary Create Respone
CustomTypes.Description: Response object to Create Payment Registered Beneficiary

Fields.Name: transactionID
Fields.Description: This contains both the merchant transaction ID and the Earthport transaction iD.

Fields.Name: correspondentChargesExpected
Fields.Description: A flag to indicate if correspondent charges are expected during the processing of the payout request.

Fields.Name: liquidityValue
Fields.Description: The liquidity value debited to service the payout request. This is equivalent to the payout instruction amount.

Fields.Name: settlementValue
Fields.Description: The settlement value that will be sent by instruction to the settlement bank. This value may be subject to charges applied by correspondent banks before being received by the beneficiary bank account. This will typically match the currency of the beneficiary bank account, unless this instruction will be settled using FX on receipt.

Fields.Name: acceptedDate
Fields.Description: Timestamp when the payout instruction was accepted by the system. (This is known as - and is the same as - the debit value date in the Payout Transaction Detail Type).

Fields.Name: expectedSettlementDate
Fields.Description: Indicative date when the payout instruction is expected to be settled to the bank. This is calculated taking into account such things as acceptedDate, the settlement agreement cut-off time and period, etc. It currently does not take into account individual countries' banking calendars.

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryIdentityGroup
CustomTypes.Description: This type defines a beneficiary identity data group. Each group is normally represented as a section of fields on the UI. 'groupLabel' is the UI test to display as a name for this section. 'mandatory' indicates whether all section is mandatory. 'elementName' is the name of the element in the addBeneficiaryBankAccount request document for the corresponding section.

Fields.Name: elementName
Fields.Description: The name of the Earthport element/enum in the addBeneficiaryBankAccount.

Fields.Name: groupLabel
Fields.Description: Displays a label for this group of identity fields.

Fields.Name: mandatory
Fields.Description: Indicates that all the fields within the group are mandatory.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryIdentityFieldsList
Fields.Description: A list of identity fields to be displayed within this group.

CustomTypes.ExampleValue:
{
  "elementName": "name",
  "groupLabel": "Enter name",
  "mandatory": true,
  "beneficiaryIdentityFieldsList": {
    "beneficiaryIdentityField": [
      {
        "description": "Enter the first name of the beneficiary",
        "displaySize": 35,
        "elementName": "givenNames",
        "inputType": "text",
        "locale": "en",
        "mandatory": "true",
        "maxSize": 1024,
        "subTitle": "The first name of the beneficiary",
        "tabOrder": 1
      },
      {
        "description": "Enter the family name of the beneficiary",
        "displaySize": 35,
        "elementName": "familyName",
        "inputType": "text",
        "locale": "en",
        "mandatory": "true",
        "maxSize": 1024,
        "subTitle": "The family name of the beneficiary",
        "tabOrder": 2
      }
    ]
  }
}

CustomTypes.Name: BeneficiaryBankAccountGroupsList
CustomTypes.Description: This type defines a list of bank account data groups. Each group is normally represented as a row on the UI.

Fields.Name: beneficiaryBankAccountFieldGroup
Fields.Description: List of beneficiary bank account groups.

Fields.Name: userID
Fields.Description: This group consists of all possible user identifier types.

CustomTypes.Name: IndividualIdentity
CustomTypes.Description: The identity of an individual. The 'name' attribute is mandatory for an individual. You must supply at least identification entry or one birth information entry or one address entry.

Fields.Name: name
Fields.Description:
The 'givenNames' attribute is mandatory. This is a space separated list of names (not including the family name).

You should supply names and not initials (wherever possible). See examples below.

The 'familyName' attribute is mandatory. This contains the single family name. See examples below.


*Example1 - a western citizen from a country which uses the common western naming convention(such as US, GB, FR, CA, DE etc...)*

    Name = "John Michael Smith",

    givenNames="John Michael" and familyName="Smith"


*Example2 - a citizen from a country which uses the eastern name order where the family name comes first, followed by their given names (such as Hungary, China, Japan, Korea, Singapore, Taiwan, Vietnam etc...)*

    Name = "MÃ¡o ZÃ©dÃ¿ng",

    givenNames="ZÃ©dÃ¿ng" and familyName="MÃ¡o"


    Name = "Hidetoshi Nakata",

    givenNames="Nakata" and familyName="Hidetoshi"


    Name = "Ferenc PuskÃ¡s",

    givenNames="PuskÃ¡s" and familyName="Ferenc"


*Example3 - middle east names*

    Name= "Mohammed bin Rashid bin Saeed Al-Maktoum",

    givenNames="Mohammed bin Rashid bin Saeed" and familyName="Al-Maktoum"


*Example4 - single names, such as in Indonesia*
